definition: to crowd out/to push aside/to supplant
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)

sentences.english: Those politicians are jockeying for power.
sentences.chinese: 那些政客們正在相互排擠以爭奪權力。

sentences.english: Left-wing dissidents have been emasculated and marginalised.
sentences.chinese: 左派持不同政見者已經遭到削弱和排擠。

sentences.english: Some of the smaller traders are being frozen out by big combines.
sentences.chinese: 一些小間人正受到一些大的聯公司的排擠。

sentences.english: Her passion for money excluded every other sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 她對金錢的熱愛已經把其他的感情都排擠掉了。

sentences.english: The boy was rejected by his peers due to his coarseness.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩子因爲很粗魯被同儕排擠。

sentences.english: Others have used their political allies to squeeze out foreign partners.
sentences.chinese: 其他的一些公司動用政治同盟排擠外國合作伙伴。

sentences.english: To change another words, a man who often breaks his promise will be repelled everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，不守信用的人處處都會受到排擠。

sentences.english: Jobs was forced out of Apple in 1985 by a hostile board of directors.
sentences.chinese: 喬布斯於1985年因意見分岐被排擠出蘋果公司。

sentences.english: At the same time fair daughter in the schools out, dont want to go to school.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時秀雅的女兒在學校被排擠，不願意上學。

sentences.english: They feared that smaller and less risky projects would get elbowed out of the budget.
sentences.chinese: 他們擔心一些比較不冒險的小計畫會遭到排擠。

sentences.english: One possible reason is that the old are elbowing out the young.
sentences.chinese: 一個可能的原因是年輕者被年長者排擠出就業市場。

sentences.english: Small firms are crowded out of markets for people and skills by the chaebol.
sentences.chinese: 小企業在人才與技術方面被大企業排擠出市場。

sentences.english: Prime minister was supplanted by his rival .
sentences.chinese: 首相被他的對手排擠掉了。

sentences.english: The competition became so keen that many of smaller companies were frozen out.
sentences.chinese: 競爭是如此激烈，許多較小的公司被排擠了出來。

sentences.english: He badmouthed me and stole the show.
sentences.chinese: 他說我的壞話，還排擠我以表現自己。

sentences.english: But when the revolution was won, women were pushed out.
sentences.chinese: 但當革命勝利的時候，婦女們卻被排擠在外了。

definition: to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
